Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Dish
Description: Lovely dish, typical of early New Kingdom production: the ring base is barely noticeable, the body is flat and flared and the lip straightens up and thins. The clay is coarse and common, orange with an organic temper. The exteriour is simply polished whereas the interior was covered with a shiny and polished thick red slip, which also surves to make the surface water-proof.
